verses.roman:
tīrtha-yātrā-kathā prabhu sakala kahilā
karṇāmṛta, brahma-saṁhitā,--dui puṅthi dilā

synonyms: tīrtha-yātrā-kathā—topics of His pilgrimage; prabhu—Lord Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; sakala kahilā—described everything; karṇāmṛta—the book named Kṛṣṇa-karṇāmṛta; brahma-saṁhitā—the book named Brahma-saṁhitā; dui—two; puṅthi—scriptures; dilā—delivered.
translation: Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu gave Rāmānanda Rāya a vivid description of His travels to the holy places and told him how He had acquired the two books named Kṛṣṇa-karṇāmṛta and Brahma-saṁhitā. The Lord delivered the books to Rāmānanda Rāya.
